page.title: Blue-Chip Stocks Dip, AIG Rises
page.text: NEW YORK (Reuters) - U.S. blue chips declined slightly early Monday afternoon, with gains in insurance company American International Group Inc. <A HREF="http://www.investor.reuters.com/FullQuote.aspx?ticker=AIG.N target=/stocks/quickinfo/fullquote">AIG.N</A> and Wal-Mart Stores Inc. <A HREF="http://www.investor.reuters.com/FullQuote.aspx?ticker=WMT.N target=/stocks/quickinfo/fullquote">WMT.N</A> offsetting a drop in energy stocks, which fell along with crude oil prices.
